boat.full_description:
Built in Cardif, 1875, Madcap worked as a Bristol Channel Pilot Cutter until after World War I when she was sold and converted for leisure use.

Read an account of a passage to the Channel Islands and North Brittany in 1967 on 'Sailing by'.

Madcap has cruised extensively since 1998, including the west coast of Greenland, via Iceland, from Ireland south to Cornwall, Brittany, the Mediterreran, Almerimar, Morocco, Palma and Alicante, down to the Azores and Lorient and north to the west coast of Scotland.
boat.short_description: Reputed to be the only remaining, original Bristol Pilot Cutter still in commission, originally built in 1875, Madcap has a remarkable history.
